title: Seriously, can we stop pretending Mages NEED Rylais?
body:
I see so many people say that Rylais is 100% necessary for their beloved mages to succeed.

Newsflash!:
Their kits were designed to work on their own.

Brand's job is NOT to permaslow you with his 4 second passive or just keep you slowed long enough for his spells to kill you.
He's supposed to be this explosive AoE Nuker who'll obliterate the entire enemy team with his 3 stack AoE passive.
That's what he's supposed to be, no Rylais needed, just enough damage to do so!

Viktor's job is to just reign supreme in Teamfights with strong AoE spells-
He has a huge AoE Slow/stun/Knockup field, a strong AoE Nuke, a mobile Q kite spell and a devastating AoE team fight nuke cloud


Syndra's job is NOT to slow you with repeated Q spams that lead up into a R instakill just cause she managed to keep you slowed long enough for her to kill you.
She's about setting up her balls, stun you and kill you with the setup she had with managing her balls

Nidalee's job is NOT to slow you with long ranged spears and go for a kill after repeatedly having hit it and kept you in range to all in you.


The pattern is clear;
Rylais provides an ADDED bonus to these champion's kit, not something that's 100% necessary.
In fact I'd argue that the slow is excessive power and being abused just because the item offers a ton of AP:



Seriously, anyone who thinks it should be a core part of a Mage's build is either:
A) High
B) Dumb as heck
C) A masochist
or, most likely
D) A mage main

EDIT;
Can we all agree that at LEAST the AP and Slow should be lowered?

Veigar's stun to me feels very unhealthy because he relies on it heavilyy to land his kit and when you are stuck in it and not a tank then you're forced to either dance around avoiding skill shots and the like from the enemy team or walking into a 3 second stun. Actually, the whole "Dancing around dodging spells" thing is the intended effect. If he manages to cage you successfully, he should be rewarded, even moreso if he manages to land the stun, due to the delay on the ability and how close he must be as a squishy champion in order to use it.

(Also, the spell is called "Event Horizon." It honestly should've had that dash-stop mechanic sooner. It's supposed to be this "inescapable trap" (Unless you can teleport outside of it). Keeping in mind as well that the stun is only at the edges of the ability, making it arguably the most difficult stun to use in the game.)
Would you rather his Q be a point and click spell again?

Isn't the whole point of having a team supposed to be everyone compensating for everyone else's weaknesses?

Tanks are supposed to help lock down targets/protect squishies.

Fighters/bruisers are supposed to go toe to toe everyone in their path, making the enemy team focus them.

Marksmen are supposed to provide valuable ranged ad damage for taking down turrets safely

 mages are supposed be a hybrid of marksmen and fighters, people who take down everyone from range, but also attract attention

And assassins are meant to stop marksmen/mages and punish super high dps comps by neutering the enemy teams damage

remove my slow, but give me more damage instead

#bring back 120 ap options.

Rylais is popular because ap is down has a whole and cdr is up. Before you had to go out of your way to get high cdr at the cost of damage. Now cdr is on everything and damage is now more in item actives (protobelt and the icicle thing). Rylais was more situational before because there were more high damage items, and before it was either you dumped all your spells at once and killed the guy or you didn't and now you have nothing up. In either case you didn't need a slow. Now you know your not gonna kill the guy but your spells are up a lot faster so you get another go at it and rylais helps you land the next combo.

Rylais itself hasn't changed since 5.22 (where its cost went from 3000 to 3200). However a lot of other items have changed and rylais has found itself at the top because everything else pales in comparison to it. 

Instead of destroying an item that wasn't an issue before why don't we try to fix the other items so it doesn't look like the best choice every time. Lower available cdr (in the game as a whole imo) so its something you have to opt into instead of it being added on because theres no way around it. Bring back high end ap items. If rylais is still a problem then revert the 4.13 change where ryalis was given 20 more ap and lost 100 health. Yes its been that long that rylais has been 100 ap and no one complained.

Viktor has a 42.5% winrate when not using Rylai's.

For comparison, Mordekaiser has a 41.8% winrate without Rylai's

Viktor is dependent on the item.
Or maybe the reason is no Viktor player in their right mind would pass up on Rylai's in its current state, and the only ones that would are non Viktor players or low skill players in general?
That's not the reason.

What he's saying is from a purely statistical standpoint correct. You have a correlation, no actual causation. It is possible that better Viktor players understand that Rylai's is a strong item and are more likely to buy it but even if they didn't they'd be more likely to win the game.

Another thing to keep in mind is that games where Viktor doesn't buy Rylai's also includes the subset of games where Viktor gets crushed so thoroughly that he never has enough gold for Rylai's. 

Where would I personally assume this falls? Somewhere in the middle. If you straight up restricted Viktor from buying Rylai's his winrate wouldn't fall to 42.5%, because there would be good players who can no longer buy the item but are still good enough at the champ to win a large amount of games. There would also still be games where Viktor can never finish items anyway, so his winrate would drop, but not all the way to 52.5, which means there are other factors than just Rylai's being strong on Viktor as well.

What he's saying is not statistically correct, as he has no statistics. He's making a guess based on the assumption that Rylai's isn't needed.

Rylai's is purchased on Viktor 70% of the time. I believe that only brand and Morde buy it more often (74% and 80% respectively), so it's not just the top players that build it. It's almost all of the playerbase. It's beyond well known that this is core. My guess, and this is a guess, nothing that I can prove, is that the games he doesn't build it, are VS. AP assassins where he would consider building Abyssal.

But not, Rylai's is absolutely necessary for Viktor, and his performance with and without show this.

>What he's saying is not statistically correct, as he has no statistics. He's making a guess based on the assumption that Rylai's isn't needed.

No, it's correct on the basis of the theory of statistics, hence statistically correct and what you're doing is making a guess that he does need Rylai's. You have no actual evidence to prove what the cause of the correlation is you can just prove that there's a correlation.

Repeat the basic law of statistics after me, Correlation=/=Causation.

What the other guy is saying is

>Or maybe the reason is no Viktor player in their right mind would pass up on Rylai's in its current state, and the only ones that would are non Viktor players or low skill players in general?

He is suggesting another manner that the causation could work in. He is not saying 'the causation must work in this manner', hence the word maybe.

>Rylai's is purchased on Viktor 70% of the time. I believe that only brand and Morde buy it more often (74% and 80% respectively), so it's not just the top players that build it. It's almost all of the playerbase.

But you cannot prove that it's not simply the bottom 30% of Viktor players not buying Rylai's. The fact that Viktor's build rate of Rylai's increases linearly with rank actually supports this idea.

Basically you can't make any statistically significant call based off of the evidence you have, because the evidence only shows a correlation. 

Trust me, I've been trough this. I've done a Statistics class, what they ask you to do any time you want to suggest that your stats prove anything is to think of every other way possible that your two variables could be interacting with each other other than the way you've proposed. If you can't disprove these, which trust me you normally can't then you can't use statistics to prove anything.

Holy God.

You've done a statistic's class? 

I guess I should just trust you over ton's of evidence. 

Also people that say Morde is reliant on Rylai's despite identical information are incorrect, and he'll be fine if that item is removed. Can't prove it's just the really good players that build it on him, right?

The winrate has risen alongside usage of Rylais to the point where it is built in an abnormally high percentage of games, with a commensurately high winrate while using the item, and an abnormally low winrate when not using the item.

>Ask for a refund for that statistics class you took.

I'm literally telling you the basic principles of statistics and how they apply here and you are trying to refute them. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Correlation_does_not_imply_causation

Read this, you need it. You are talking about entirely correlations. Viktor's winrate increase correlated with Rylai's being a more colon item. It also correlated with minor buffs and players learning Viktor. Viktor players skill levels also correlate with the amount he buys Rylai's. It's possible that Rylai's is marginally better and better players understand this marginal advantage and are more likely to exploit it, but would also be more likely to win than a bad player even if they didn't.

I'm not arguing against it being important. What I'm saying is that there are probably other factors. It is true that more skilled Viktor players are more likely to build Rylai's. It is also true that sometimes Viktor gets crushed so drastically that he can't even finish Rylai's before the game ends. Both of these things also factor into Viktor's subpar winrate without Rylai's.

You know, he wouldn't need it if his delays weren't as abnormally high.

Nothing a few number tweaks wouldn't fix.
So, then can we stop pretending mages don't need Rylai's and understand that if the item gets changed they will need adjustment.

Honestly no champion should be 100% reliant on a item that's bad design because if anything happens to the idea it will broken the champion in question. I'm not saying mages need or don't need rylai's. I'm just saying champions should be able to feel their roles without the need of certain items.

I see conversations about Morde needing this item, Aurelion Sol, etc, but there's one champion that I think really does need this to succeed.

Taliyah. I know, I know, I'm probably the only person in the world that actually plays her (partly because I can't help but love the champion herself, lore, personality, etc), but it feels like that you're relatively useless until you get Rylai's. Mostly because her only other form of CC is on an over-ten-second cooldown and it synergizes well with her Q. Plus, as others have stated, the health and AP really help in her build path when she doesn't really have an escape option (except Ult but that can't even be used reliably in fights as an escape). Protobelt helps this in some regard, but it's still a bit difficult.

My opinion? Give it much less AP and give it much more health. It's mainly an item to support your kit, anyway, so treat it as such. Those that love the health to keep a bit tanky and love the slow will still pick it up, but it should reduce the amount of mages picking it up because it has such high AP. Of course, another high AP item should be given back in compensation, but that's how it should go. 

I mean, look at Frozen Mallet, the AD alternative. It has like 30 AD and 700 health or something like that. Shouldn't Rylai's be similar?

You are ignoring the most important reason why mages build Rylais, to counter the high mobility champions. This makes it a must buy for mages. 

Plus your argument is completely wrong on every side. Brand wants it to keep the enemies from moving apart so they take more damage from the AoE effects. Viktor wants them slowed to get hit again by the second burst of Death Ray. Syndra wants them slowed down to set up her multi-player stun. Nid doesn't really need it (simply because she is broken as hell), but it doesn't hurt. 

To combat the huge mobility creep that has taken over the game, mages absolutely need to build it. If you don't want it to be a required item, get Riot to gut the stupid levels of mobility on some champs.
